alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 9:58AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HIGH WATER ON GULF COAST AND ICY STRAIT CORRIDOR RIVERS AND STREAMS... The heavy rain from an atmospheric river moving through the panhandle has moved off to the east of the area. Yakutat Airport received over 8 inches of rain from Wednesday night through Saturday morning, while parts of the Icy Strait Corridor received around 1 to 2 inches total. The Situk River near Yakutat is currently still within its banks but it is running much higher then its usual water level Saturday morning. It crested at around 70.2 feet around 4 am this morning, which is just below bankfull stage of 70.5 feet, and is on its way down. Other rivers near Yakutat, are expected to remain within their banks, but are still running higher then usual. Water levels are expected to gradually recede through the weekend. Areas around the Icy Strait Corridor only got around 2 inches of rainfall total or less. Rivers are well within their banks Saturday morning as a result, but some are running a little bit higher then normal. Recreators in and around areas rivers, especially along the NE Gulf Coast, should monitor water levels through the holiday weekend.
